events.name: Singapore Lync User Group Meeting (March 2015)
events.description: Bio: Akhil Behl has over 12 years of experience in IT and Telecom industry. He is currently employed with Orange Business Services in capacity of Pre-Sales Solutions Architect. Prior to his present role, he was with Cisco Systems for 10 years, where he has contributed in various roles; as Manager Advanced Services in a leadership role; as Solutions Architect Advanced Services team providing (PPDIOO) end-to-end services delivery to Cisco’s key customers world-wide; as a Network Consulting Engineer in Cisco Advanced Services, and as an Escalation Engineer at Cisco Technical Assistance Center (TAC). Prior to Cisco, he was with Linksys as a Technical Support Lead. Akhil has a Bachelor of Technology Degree in Electronics and Telecommunications from MAIT, IP University, India, and a Master's Degree in Business Administration from Symbiosis Institute, India. He is a dual Cisco Certified Internetwork Expert (CCIE No. 19564) in Collaboration and Security. He also holds many other industry certifications, such as PMP, TOGAF (EA), ITIL (Foundation), VCP, CEH, MCP, CCNA, CCDA, CCDP, CCSP, CCVP, and ISO/IEC 27002. He has multiple research papers published in IEEE, international and national (India) journals on Cloud, Security, and VoIP. Akhil is the author of two Cisco Press books – Securing Cisco IP Telephony Networks http:// goo.gl/yO23pV and CCIE Collaboration Quick Reference http:// goo.gl/N1VGNq During his leisure time, Akhil enjoys spending time with family, playing console games, and writing/reading articles. Agenda: Introduction to Collaborative Technologies Cisco Collaboration Architecture Overview An introduction to Cisco and Microsoft Interoperability An Insight to Cisco UC Integration with Microsoft Lync An Insight to Cisco Video Integration with Microsoft Summary The agenda will be for someone with strong Cisco background to provide best practices for building a efficient Lync - Cisco Inter-op. Will update with synopsis and speaker profile.
events.location: Microsoft Singapore, One Marina Boulevard, Level 22, Meeting Room

events.name: IoT Security, Infrastructure Security and Security News Bytes - Monthly meetup
events.description: All our Null Singapore meets are Free and Open to all, just register and join us. Agenda : 6:30 - 6:45 Networking with fellow hackers 6:45 - 7:00 Security News Bites by Suman Sourav 7:00 - 7:40 IoT and security challenges by Randen Rosete 7:45 - 8:40 Experiences, lessons learned and approaches to infrastructure security by Sriram Narayanan Brief overview of the talks Security News Bites: A quick 15 min run down of the current happenings in security industry and anything which has some impact on anything related to information security. e.g., IoT and Security challenges: 1. Introduction to IoT/M2M 2. Application of IoT 3. Challenges - security otherwise general 4. The future of IoT Experiences, lessons learned and approaches to infrastructure security: Sriram will share his experiences of one of the attacks that he had to deal with, of mistakes made and lessons learned, and his current approaches to infrastructure security. About Speakers: Randen Rosete : I have been a software engineer for the past 12 years, working on both Enterprise/Proprietary and Open Source Technologies. Currently I'm more involve in developing API and mobile applications. I had been interested with security and applies it to how I'm developing my applications. Sriram “Ram” Narayanan : Sriram “Ram” Narayanan, works with ThoughtWorks and helps customers get their products to market earlier by improving Release Engineering and Infrastructure Automation. He is a regular speaker, sharing lessons learned and ideas for improvement. When not working with technology, he is off practicing music or swimming. Suman Sourav : Suman is having 10 years of experience in application & cloud security engineering, operation for banking & financial institutions, consulting firms, cloud service providers. He is working with Autodesk since last 1 year as Senior Security analyst for Product Security team. He has in-depth knowledge of secure software development lifecycle & vulnerability management, currently he is engaged with different product teams to reduce the software security issues in their products in development lifecycle, also providing guidance in making appropriate changes in process and policies in accordance to adopt the security process in development lifecycle.
events.group_name: Null Singapore - The Open Security Community

events.name: Lean Beer
events.description: Grab a beer, be merry and have a Lean Coffee style discussion. We will be focusing on the topics that are of interest to you. Anything from Kanban (duh), Scrum, Lean, Lean UX, Lean Startup, Agile practices to issues that you are addressing with the team today. Topic generation will be from 6:30 - 6:45pm. Discussion from 6:45pm onwards Beginners to experts are all welcome!

events.name: March Dribbble Meetup
events.description: Sessions Xiaodan is sharing a case study of millennium hotel where the design was well received by the clients and users. The talk will cover rapid design, prototyping and research example. James is sharing a short talk on content-driven– and continuous design. Or, How I Learned to Love Uncertainty & Stop Designing Everything Upfront. Some case studies from the trenches.
events.location: ThoughtWorks Pte. Ltd. 87B Amoy Street, Level 3 Singapore 069906
